ETYMOLOGY: From Old French misere, from Latin miseria ('wretchedness'), from miser ('wretched, pitiable').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: a word (other than a pronoun) that is used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun)
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A state of great unhappiness, suffering, or distress.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 极度不幸福、痛苦或苦恼的状态。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: After losing everything, she was plunged into a state of utter misery.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 在失去一切之后，她陷入了彻底的痛苦之中。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: a word (other than a pronoun) that is used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun)
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A cause or source of great suffering or unhappiness. Often used in plural.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 造成极大痛苦或不幸福的原因或来源。常用于复数形式。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The miseries of war are endless and affect countless lives.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 战争带来的苦难是无穷无尽的，影响着无数生命。
